company_context: Welcome to The Apache Software Foundation | Apache Software Foundation Introducing The ASF’s New Logo Read Now Toggle navigation Community Contributor Getting Started Becoming a Committer Code of Conduct Community Resources Community Over Code Events Projects Projects Incubator Projects Projects Directory Mailing Lists Report a Vulnerability The Apache Attic Downloads Distributions Releases Learn Blog How the ASF Works The Apache Way Legal & Trademark Licenses Glossary FAQ Resources & Tools Developer Information Wiki Issues Slack Self Serve Portal Infrastructure Infrastructure Status Infrastructure Statistics Whimsy Brand Guidelines Project Logos About About Our Sponsors Corporate Sponsorship Individual Supporters Leadership Members Diversity & Inclusion Newsroom Contact Sponsor Search Software For The Public Good ¶ The Apache® Software Foundation (ASF) provides software for the public good, guided by community over code. Like the enduring oak tree, our projects thrive through the contributions of thousands worldwide. See Projects Our Impact ¶ 290+ Open Source Projects 1300+ Software Releases 9800+ Committers 1140+ Members Our Open Source Projects ¶ The ASF is the home of the world’s most trusted open source projects in data, cloud, search, libraries, geospatial, IoT, and beyond. See All Projects Our Incubating Projects ¶ See All Incubating Projects Incubate a Project ¶ Give your project a neutral, trusted home where communities flourish — with the ASF’s expertise, tools, and support to help you succeed. Incubate Project Everyone is Welcome ¶ At The ASF, contribution is for everyone. Whether code, docs, or ideas — your +1 makes a difference. Come contribute and grow with us. New to The ASF? Start here Upcoming Events ¶ Flink Forward 2026 ¶ Shenzen, China ¶ July 11-12, 2026 Flink Forward is the streaming data event for the future, bringing communities together to learn, network, and share experiences and best practices in stream processing, real time analytics, event-driven applications, AI and real-time intelligence, and the management of mission-critical Flink deployments in production. See Event ❮ ❯ Thank You, Sponsors ¶ The ASF is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit, supported by individual and corporate donors who believe in secure software for the public good and the power of community over code. See All Sponsors ASF Plus One ¶ Explore what’s new at The ASF — from project news to community voices, all in one place. conversation.speaker: Seller
conversation.message: Hi, my name is Alex, and I'm reaching out from DeepData AI. We're a data processing solution that helps companies like yours optimize their data workflows. I came across The Apache Software Foundation and was impressed by the work you're doing in the open-source community. Can you tell me a bit about your current data processing challenges?

conversation.speaker: Buyer
conversation.message: Ah, yes, we do have some challenges with data processing, but we're a non-profit organization, and our budget is limited. We rely heavily on open-source solutions and community contributions. I'm not sure if we can afford a commercial solution like yours.

conversation.speaker: Seller
conversation.message: I completely understand your concerns about budget. However, our solution has been shown to increase efficiency and reduce costs in the long run. We've worked with several non-profit organizations in the past, and we're open to discussing flexible pricing options. Can you tell me more about your current data processing workflow and what specific challenges you're facing?

conversation.speaker: Buyer
conversation.message: Well, we're currently using a combination of Apache Beam and Apache Spark for our data processing needs. While they're great tools, we're struggling to integrate them with our other systems and scale our workflows. But I'm not sure if we're ready to invest in a new solution right now. We're in the middle of planning our budget for the next quarter.

conversation.speaker: Seller
conversation.message: I understand that timing can be a challenge. However, our solution can actually help you optimize your existing workflows and integrate with your current tools, including Apache Beam and Apache Spark. We've had success with similar organizations in the past, and I'd love to show you a demo of how our solution can help. Would you be open to a 30-minute demo next week?

conversation.speaker: Buyer
conversation.message: I'm not sure...I'd need to discuss this with our team and get approval from our board. We're also evaluating other solutions, including some open-source options. I don't want to commit to a demo without knowing more about your pricing and how it compares to our current costs.

conversation.speaker: Seller
conversation.message: I completely understand. We're transparent about our pricing, and I can provide you with a customized quote based on your specific needs. However, I want to assure you that our solution can provide significant value to your organization. As a non-profit, we're also open to discussing discounted pricing options. Can I schedule a follow-up call to discuss pricing and answer any questions you may have?

conversation.speaker: Buyer
conversation.message: No, I don't think so. We're not looking to add any new vendors or solutions to our budget this quarter, and we're happy with our current open-source tools. I appreciate the offer, but I think we'll have to decline.

analysis.raw:
Score: 4
Outcome: Failure
Key_Objection: Price
Feedback: The seller should have provided a clearer and more detailed pricing quote earlier in the conversation to address the buyer's budget concerns and potentially overcome the price objection. Sentiment: Neutral
